intro: Dryadella elata, commonly known as the slender dryad, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central America. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant features slender, erect stems with lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It produces showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. Dryadella elata is adapted to grow in well-drained soils and is often found in moist, shaded environments.
